com.example.vitabu

Class AddBookFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • com.example.vitabu.AddBookFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class AddBookFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
    This class deals with the add book fragment and adding a new book for the user.
    See Also:
    browseBooksActivity

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This function initializes the view when the user clicks on the Add Book button in the bottom navigation bar.
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater - this inflates the fragment_add_book.xml file to fill out the screen.
        container - this is the container that has all the information about the screen view itself.
        savedInstanceState - this keeps the state of the screen when another fragment is being viewed
        Returns:
        the view that the fragment is situated in.

      • onActivityResult

        public void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                             int resultCode,
                             android.content.Intent data)
        This function processes the Scan ISBN button result (placing the scanned ISBN into the ISBN text field) and the add image button result.
        Overrides:
        onActivityResult in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        requestCode - the number that lets us know which activity returned.
        resultCode - the number identifying the fact that the activity finished as intended
        data - the intent that contains the data passed back from the previous activity.

      • attemptAddingBook

        public void attemptAddingBook(android.view.View view)
        This function will attempt to add the book into the database. On success will notify the user and clear the screen of the previous input.
        Parameters:
        view - the view where this fragment resides.

      • updateUsersBooksOwned

        public void updateUsersBooksOwned(User user)
        This function will increment the number of books that user owns in the database.
        Parameters:
        user - the user for which we need to increment the books owned counter.

      • onAddImageClick

        public void onAddImageClick(android.view.View view)
        This function will add an image linked to the book from the user.
